utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there. Joey is holding a deck of cards out to Chandler.]

utterances.transcript: Okay, pick a card.
Okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay. (He picks the 9 of Spades)

utterances.transcript: All right now, memorize it. You got it?
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right now, memorize it. (Pause) You got it?

utterances.transcript: Oh yes.
Is that your card?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (holding up the Queen of Clubs) Is that your card? (He winks and smiles.)

utterances.transcript: Yes.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (pause) Yes.
(Joey laughs then realizes the trick didn't work when Chandler hands him his card back.)

utterances.transcript: Hey guys!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering with Ben and Ross) Hey guys!

utterances.transcript: Hi!
Hi there!
Hi!!
Guess what? Ben is going to be in a TV commercial!
What are you talking about?!

Well, it's not for sure but umm, we met this guy in the park who thought Ben was really cute--y'know, which he is--so umm anyhoo, he uh, he gave us his card and told us to bring him down for this commercial he's auditioning.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sets Ben down) Well, it's not for sure but umm, we met this guy in the park who thought Ben was really cute--y'know, which he is--so umm anyhoo, he uh, he gave us his card and told us to bring him down for this commercial he's auditioning.

utterances.transcript: Whoa! This guy is like the biggest commercial casting director in town! Ben takes one lousy walk in the park and gets an audition!! I mean, way to go Ben! Man! I've been in that park a million times and no one offered me an audition.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (reading the card) Whoa! This guy is like the biggest commercial casting director in town! (Ross gasps) Ben takes one lousy walk in the park and gets an audition!! (Ross and Carol stare at him, then Joey realizes what he just said.) I mean, way to go Ben! (Gives Ben the thumbs up, which Ben returns.) Man! I've been in that park a million times and no one offered me an audition.

utterances.transcript: I know, it's crazy! We were just pushing Ben on the swings...
I'm always on the swings! What am I doing wrong?!
That.

plots: Carol told them that Ben is going to be auditioning for a commercial and Joey is really surprised .
Joey tries to show Chandler a trick with a deck of cards but fails .
Ross ' son Ben has been offered the chance to become a star in a soup commercial , which an envious Joey finds hard to accept .
Joey tries to do a magic trick for Chandler but fails .
Chandler ends up telling Joey that the real reason he messed up the part is because , deep down , Joey wanted Ben to get it , which Joey finds as a good excuse .
Joey fails at performing a card trick even though Chandler says Joey performed the trick right , and when Joey realizes it , Joey laughs .
Joey gets frustrated about how Ben got an audition by just swinging on the swings in the park when Joey goes swinging all the time .
Joey is angry that Ben got an audition in a TV commercial and Joey did n't
Chandler makes fun of Joey for playing on the swings in Central park just like Ben .
Ross and Carol announce that their son will be in a tv commericial
Chandler draws a card other than the Queen of Clubs but says that it Chandler 's card regardless .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is eating breakfast, Ross is heading for the bathroom.]

utterances.transcript: Okay, gotta go! Wish me luck!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering from her room) Okay, gotta go! Wish me luck!

utterances.transcript: Luck!
Hey Rach, now that you're working at Ralph Lauren, can you bring me back some of those polo shirts?
Uh well, y'know what? I don't think if I feel comfortable stealing on my very first day...
Unwilling to steal from work, interesting.
Besides, if anybody's gonna get free stuff, it's gonna be me.
Okay guys, way to wish me luck!
Good luck! Go get 'em!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Good luck! Go get 'em! (Rachel exits.)

utterances.transcript: Okay, let's discuss Rachel's birthday. I say we throw a surprise party this weekend.
Whoa-whoa, but her birthday isn't like for another month.
Yeah but if we throw her a party on her birthday, then it's not a surprise.
I think it's a great idea. Yeah, we could have a dinner party and just invite her close friends.
Ross!! We're having a surprise party for Rachel!!
Okay!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (from the bathroom) Okay!!

utterances.transcript: Done.
Okay, great so do you want to do it together?
I would love to do it together!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Joey starts to giggle.)

utterances.transcript: They're gonna do it together.
Dude! That's my girlfriend!
What, so I gotta shut it down now?
All right, I gotta take off. I'm picking up Ben then we're off to the big audition.
It's gonna be weird to watch some actor pretending to be Ben's dad.
Yeah.
Weirder than watching his two moms make out?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Weirder than watching his two moms make out? (Monica nods in agreement.)

utterances.transcript: Whoa-whoa dad? There's a dad in the commercial?
Yeah the dad and Ben eat soup and pretend to enjoy it.
Whoa, hey, maybe I'll go down there with ya and see if I can get an audition to play the dad. I mean who better to play Ben's father than his godfather.
You're not his godfather.
What?! Are you kidding?!
Of course I am! Okay, let's go godfather.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Pause) Of course I am! (Joey is relieved) Okay, let's go godfather.

utterances.transcript: All right!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (As they walk out he motions to Chandler that he is still Ben's godfather.)
[Scene: Ben's audition, Carol, Ross, and Ben along with about 10 more families are in a waiting room as Joey enters happily.]

utterances.transcript: Hey! I'm in, they're gonna let me audition!
Really? That's great!
I know! I know! It turns out that one of the casting ladies has actually seen me in a play, so I steered clear of her...
Hey, that kid looks familiar.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (noticing a kid who has picked up a copy of Variety to read) Hey, that kid looks familiar.

utterances.transcript: Oh yeah, yeah! He's done tons of commercials. I've seen him in like Sugar Smacks, Playstation, and that one for the phone company. In fact he was so good in that one, he actually convinced me to switch phone companies. Chandler was mad....
Yeah well, he's not gonna get this one. Ben is way cuter than that kid. I mean look at him, look at you,
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah well, he's not gonna get this one. Ben is way cuter than that kid. I mean look at him, look at you, (Starts to whine like a baby and Joey just glares at him.)

utterances.transcript: That's great. Listen, wouldn't it be great though if I got to play Ben's dad?
Joey, you look nothing like Ben.
I look more like him than you do!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I look more like him than you do! (He winks at Carol.)

utterances.transcript: Y'know, I don't really know you well enough for you to do that.

plots: At Ben 's audition , one of the kids has already done loads of commercials but Ross thinks Ben is still in with a good chance because Ben is way cuter .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Rachel's new job, she's in her new boss's office (Kim's) and with the other assistant (Nancy). Together they're deciding what clothes to buy or something, who knows, let's all watch/read to find out.]

utterances.transcript: So it's down to these two, Nancy I know you like this one and I think I agree. Rachel, what do you think?
Well umm, that one is pretty but uh, I just, I just love this fabric Sorry.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well umm, that one is pretty but uh, I just, I just love this fabric (On the other one.) Sorry.

utterances.transcript: Oh don't be sorry, that's part of your job here to give your opinions and then I take credit for them--I'm kidding.
She is kidding, but don't ever disagree with her again. Okay, now I'm kidding!
Oh, what a fun office.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (laughing nervously) Oh, what a fun office.

utterances.transcript: I don't know which one, but I do know I need a cigarette. So what do you say we take a break, we go outside, and we'll figure this out when we come back?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They all get up to leave.)

utterances.transcript: Rachel? Do you smoke?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (at the door) Rachel? Do you smoke?

utterances.transcript: Oh no, my dad's a doctor and he would always tell me just horror stories......about ghosts and goblins who totally supported the princess's right to smoke.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh no, my dad's a doctor and he would always tell me just horror stories...(stops and tries to change directions)...about ghosts and goblins who totally supported the princess's right to smoke.

plots: On the first day at her work , Rachel tries to get along with her new colleague and boss Nancy and Kim .
Rachel 's coworker , Nancy , has a tight relaionship with her boss Kim and it makes Rachel nervous .
The latter two are smokers , and go out on a cigarette break every morning , which Rachel ca n't join as Rachel does n't smoke .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is telling Chandler and Monica about her day.]

utterances.transcript: ...and then they came back from smoking and they had made all of the decisions without me!
That doesn't seem fair.
I know! It's like I'm being punished for not having this disgusting, poisoning habit!
Yeah, it is the best.

I mean what if this keeps happening? Y'know, they'll-they'll be outside smoking, making all the decisions and I'll just be up in my office breathing my stupid clean air, y'know? And then when the day comes when Kim wants to promote one of us, who do you think she's gonna pick? Me or Smokey Smokerson?
Rachel, you can go down there, you don't have to smoke. Just say you wanna get some fresh air.
Yeah, I can do that.
Yeah, or you can do the easy thing and smoke.
Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Hey Rach, you wanna get some coffee?
I would love to!
Oh good!
Yeah, I wanna go to babe.
Oh good.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They all start out.)

utterances.transcript: Oh wait, I change my mind! Okay, let's talk about the party! I have so many ideas!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh wait, I change my mind! (She slams the door on them.) Okay, let's talk about the party! I have so many ideas! (Holds up a cocktail napkin.)

utterances.transcript: Yeah, me too!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, me too! (Runs and grabs her 3-ring binder of ideas.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, look at that.

All right, that's a little sketch of the cake, umm some sample menus, umm y'know what I thought we would start out with Tuscan style finger food, and for music, here's an alphabetized list of all my CDs! I've highlighted the ones that would go really good with the food.
What happened to the intimate dinner party?
Oh, we're not doing that. Okay...
So wow, it looks like you took care of everything. Thanks a lot, co-host.
What?! I didn't take care of everything, there's-there's plenty of things for you to do!
Like what?
Cups.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Thinks) Cups.

utterances.transcript: Cups? You're giving me cups?
And ice!
Cups and ice? Ooh, I get to be in charge of cups and ice? All right. Fine, okay, I will be in charge of cups and ice!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Cups and ice? Ooh, I get to be in charge of cups and ice? (Thinks of something) All right. Fine, okay, I will be in charge of cups and ice!

utterances.transcript: Wait a minute, I can get ice at the restaurant...
I got it! Mine!
Hi.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, downtrodden) Hi.

utterances.transcript: Hey! How'd the audition go?!
Not so good.
Wait a minute, are you doing Joey's "Audition didn't go so well. Yeah it did?"
utterances.transcript_with_note: Wait a minute, are you doing Joey's (sadly) "Audition didn't go so well. (Happily) Yeah it did?"

utterances.transcript: Yeah I am! Yeah, Ben got a second audition!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Pause) Yeah I am! Yeah, Ben got a second audition!

utterances.transcript: Yeah, I had to teach Ross my bit because I actually didn't get a callback.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (also downtrodden) Yeah, I had to teach Ross my bit because I actually didn't get a callback.

utterances.transcript: You got a callback too didn't you?
Yeah I did!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Happily) Yeah I did!
[Scene: The smoker's balcony, Rachel is out to join Kim and Nancy.]

utterances.transcript: Hey Rachel, what are you doing out here?
Oh well, it's kinda lonely up there, so I just thought I would come out here and get some fresh air.
Nancy and I were talking about the fall collection.
Oh great!
So anyway we really... Honey, we're just smoking all over you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: So anyway we really... (Someone exhales and Rachel turns and coughs.) Honey, we're just smoking all over you.

utterances.transcript: Oh, sorry!
Oh that's okay.
No-no-no, we'll move you just stay right there.
utterances.transcript_with_note: No-no-no, we'll move you just stay right there. (They walk away.)

utterances.transcript: So anyway I sent the designs over to Ralph and he's very excited about the line.
Oh that's great! You are the best!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Rachel gets fed up and heads over to another smoker.)

utterances.transcript: Excuse me, can I, can I bum one of those? Y'know what, actually... Okay, okay, okay, what's so funny over here?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Excuse me, can I, can I bum one of those? (He holds up his pack.) Y'know what, actually... (She takes the one he's smoking and heads over to where Nancy and Kim are standing and laughing.) Okay, okay, okay, what's so funny over here?

utterances.transcript: I thought you didn't smoke.

Oh, I thought you guys meant marijuana cigarettes, y'know? Y'know what I mean, like dubbies? And I actually, I thought to myself, "Wow, those guys are crazy!" But no, I actually smoke the regular ones all, all the time.
We get high.
Oh, me too.
I'm kidding.
Oh, me too.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Laughs) Oh, me too.

plots: Kim and Nancy were talking about the fall collection .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Ben and Joey's (Isn't that an ice cream??) callback.]

utterances.transcript: Oh God, this is so nerve wracking! How-how do you do this?
Well, unfortunately, I don't get many callbacks so...
Is it a good sign that they asked us to hang around after the audition?
Who knows?
Okay uh, we have narrowed it down to Raymond, Ben, Kyle, and Joey. The rest of you, thank you very much.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Okay uh, we have narrowed it down to Raymond, Ben, Kyle, and Joey. The rest of you, thank you very much.

utterances.transcript: Yes!! I knew it!! Bye-bye! So long! Later!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yes!! I knew it!! (To the people who didn't make it.) Bye-bye! So long! Later!

utterances.transcript: Oh this is great! I might actually get to play Ben's dad!
Yeah!
Actually, that can't happen. Yeah because you all have such different looks, we're putting you with Raymond and Kyle with Ben. So it'll be either you two or you two.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Actually, that can't happen. Yeah because you all have such different looks, we're putting you with Raymond and Kyle with Ben. So it'll be either you two (Points to Joey and Raymond) or you two. (Points to Kyle and Ben.) (Exits.)

utterances.transcript: Man, this is gonna be kinda weird.
Yeah, it is.
Yeah. It's gonna be weird.
No, we-we're gonna be like best friends, that's why it's gonna be weird.
Oh, oh, I thought we were just talking.

plots: Joey thinks he has a chance of playing Ben 's dad , but the casting director nixes that idea .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Chandler are talking.]

utterances.transcript: Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, carrying two garbage bags) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hi!
Is it okay if I leave this stuff here 'til Rachel's birthday party?
Ah sure. What's in 'em?
Umm, cups.
Oh good, because uh we got Rachel 800 gallons of water.
Seriously that's a lot of cups.
Yeah well, that's 'cause Monica put me in charge of cups and ice, and Monica is gonna rue the day that she put me in charge of cups and ice.
Y'know I rued the day once...didn't get a whole lot else done.
Okay, time to bring up the rest of the cups. Oh, hi Joey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, time to bring up the rest of the cups. (She goes and opens the door to Joey.) Oh, hi Joey!

utterances.transcript: Hey Pheebs! Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey Pheebs! (To the guys) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Ross good, I'm uh glad you're here. I wanna talk to you about something.
What's up?

Well, I've been thinking about this whole commercial thing, y'know me going up against Ben, the two of us competing, and that can't lead to anything good. So, I think I'm just gonna step aside. I'm gonna tell them that I won't audition.
Wow, uh, Joey that's-that's great. Thanks man.
That's it? You're-you're gonna let me do this?! This-this is my career we're talking about here!
Well, you just...
I just said that so you wouldn't let Ben do it! Look Ross, if anyone should step aside it should be Ben!
What?!
What? Chandler! Tell 'em!
Well I mean, let me get the door first. Oh, hi! No one.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (shocked) Well I mean, let me get the door first. (Goes and opens the door.) Oh, hi! No one. (Exits.)

utterances.transcript: Why should Ben step aside? It was his audition in the first place! You-you just tagged along! You're like the uh, tag-a-long dad.
At least I care about his feelings!
What?!
Do you know how hard this is gonna be on him when he doesn't get it?
And why wouldn't he get it?
Oh, come on! Have you seen what my kid can do?! Huh?! I mean he dials phones! He-he-he eats tortilla chips! He-he plays soccer with the cartoon tiger!
Are you saying your kid eats soup better than my kid?
You just give him a spoon baby!
Oh yeah? I guess we'll just see!
Yeah! Because this commercial belongs to me and Mitch!
You're kid's name is Raymond!
Yeah?! So's yours!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are there as Rachel enters.]

utterances.transcript: How did work go?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Rachel) How did work go?

utterances.transcript: Oh it was great! It was great! I went down there just like you said, y'know? And we talked business. Kim totally took my opinions.
You stink!
Thanks!
No, I'm-I'm serious!
Well-well that's 'cause I went down there and they were all smoking. This is actually the smell of success.
Okay, there's something different though--Oh my God! You smoked!
I did not!
Yes you did! You look happy and sick; you smoked!
All right, fine! But I had too! I had to do it for my career!
I wish I had smoked for my career...
That's so gross!
No well, no it's not that bad, y'know? I mean yeah, my tongue feels a little fuzzy and these fingers sort of smell, I actually feel like I can throw up.
Okay, but you gotta push past this because it is about to get so good!
Chandler! I have to tell you, you smell so smokey I have to get up. I'm not kidding.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Chandler! I have to tell you, you smell so smokey I have to get up. I'm not kidding. (She's not; she stands and walks away. Chandler moves closer.)

utterances.transcript: I think you smell great!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I think you smell great! (He sniffs her shoulder.)
[Scene: The smoker's balcony, Rachel, Kim, and Nancy are all puffing away on their cancer sticks.]

utterances.transcript: So, we're decided, no on plaid, yes on pink?
Absolutely!
I am so on board!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I am so on board! (She throws away her recently lit cigarette.)

utterances.transcript: Rachel didn't you just light that?
Yeah, I did, but y'know what? I am really, really trying to cut back, y'know? Good luck, Rach.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, I did, but y'know what? I am really, really trying to cut back, y'know? (Laughs) Good luck, Rach.

utterances.transcript: I've actually been thinking about quitting lately.
Oh sure, every Sunday night I'm telling myself I'm quitting but every Monday morning it's like
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh sure, every Sunday night I'm telling myself I'm quitting but every Monday morning it's like (Mimics chain smoking.)

utterances.transcript: Tell me about it!
Well then let's just quit! We'll just quit! Let's all quit!
It does sound appealing.
Oh, I never could do it.
Oh but you could. You can. Absolutely! We can help each other out! We can get--what are those--those patches! We could be like the Patch Sisters!
Oh y'know, we really should quit. Okay, let's quit!
Yes! Great! Give me those cigs! Give it! Give it!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yes! Great! Give me those cigs! Give it! Give it! (She grabs their cigarettes and lighters and throws them in the trash.)

utterances.transcript: My late husband gave me that lighter. I'm not kidding.
utterances.transcript_with_note: My late husband gave me that lighter. (Rachel laughs.) I'm not kidding.

utterances.transcript: Okay then!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay then! (She starts rummaging through the trash to find Kim's lighter.)
[Scene: Joey and Ben's audition, Joey is rehearsing his lines, uh correction, Joey is rehearsing his line.]

utterances.transcript: Hmmm, soup! Hmm soup! Hmm, soup!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hmmm, soup! (Tries again.) Hmm soup! (Tries again, with a little caveman thrown in.) Hmm, soup!

utterances.transcript: Joey, Ross is gonna be here any second, would you mind watching Ben for me while I use the ladies' room?
Oh yeah, no problem.
Thanks.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thanks. (Exits.)

utterances.transcript: Hi Ben! So you wanna be an actor huh? I gotta tell ya, it's no picnic. There's tons of rejection. No stability. One day you're Dr. Drake Remoray, the next day you're eating ketchup right out of the bottle.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (goes over to Ben) Hi Ben! So you wanna be an actor huh? I gotta tell ya, it's no picnic. There's tons of rejection. No stability. One day you're Dr. Drake Remoray, the next day you're eating ketchup right out of the bottle.

utterances.transcript: Joey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, angrily) Joey!

utterances.transcript: Ross!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (angrily) Ross!

utterances.transcript: Ben! I mean, Ben! Ben!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (angrily) Ben! (Pause.) (Happily.) I mean, Ben! Ben!

utterances.transcript: Okay, Raymond, Joey you're up.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Okay, Raymond, Joey you're up.
(Raymond and Joey go in the office.)

utterances.transcript: Hi!
Okay, uh well, let's try one. Whenever you guys are ready.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, uh well, let's try one. Whenever you guys are ready. (Some dude puts down a couple bowls of soup in front of them.)

utterances.transcript: Uh-oh.
Is there a problem?
Well this is noodle soup and uh, I've been working with tomato. But that's okay, no problem. No problem. Hmm, noodle soup.
Y'know, that's-that's fine, but the line is, "Hmm, soup."
Oh, what did I say?
Hmm, noodle soup.
How's that different? Oh! Yeah!
utterances.transcript_with_note: How's that different? (She looks at him until he gets it.) Oh! Yeah!

utterances.transcript: All right, let's try one.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Raymond and Joey both eat a spoonful and Joey turns to Raymond and says...)

utterances.transcript: Hmm, noodle soup.
Okay. Let's do it again.
Okay.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They do it again.)

utterances.transcript: Hmm, soup. I mean, noodle soup. I mean soup!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hmm, soup. (Pause.) I mean, noodle soup. I mean soup!

utterances.transcript: COME ON!!!!
Y'know what? We need to move on.
No! No! I-I can do it one more time! See? Look! Hmm, noodle soup. Damnit!
utterances.transcript_with_note: No! No! I-I can do it one more time! See? Look! (Eats another spoonful) Hmm, noodle soup. Damnit! (Storms out.)
[Scene: The smoker's balcony, Kim and Nancy are cheating and are caught by Rachel.]

utterances.transcript: Hey! Hey-hey-hey!!
Uh-oh, busted!
Come on you guys! What are doing?! I thought we were the patch sisters!
Yeah. That didn't work out.
Rachel we tried to quit, but it was too hard!
Well y'know if you, if you started smoking again you could've at least told me! Come on, give me one of those! What are we talking about?
No. No! You're doing great! Don't you give up! That's why we didn't tell you and we're not gonna drag you down with us.
Oh wait, no-no-no! Drag me down. Drag-drag me down.

Forget it Rachel! We're both so proud of how well you're doing. I'm not gonna let you blow it. In fact, if I catch you with a cigarette, you're fired. So go on, get out of here! Go on, I don't want you breathing this stuff! Go on!
Okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay. (Starts to walk away.)

utterances.transcript: So, okay! So you'll come with me on the Paris trip.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Nancy) So, okay! So you'll come with me on the Paris trip.

utterances.transcript: Oh man!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (hearing that) Oh man!
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel's surprise party. The apartment is festooned with cups. There are cups everywhere! Cup centerpiece, cup garland, etc., etc]

utterances.transcript: Check it out! Cup hat! Cup banner! Cup chandelier! And the thing that started it all, the cup!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Chandler) Check it out! Cup hat! (Points to her hat.) Cup banner! Cup chandelier! And the thing that started it all, the cup! (Holds up one.)

utterances.transcript: Great job with the cups, Pheebs!
Why don't you just go out with her!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (overhearing that) Why don't you just go out with her!
(Chandler starts to follow her into the kitchen.)

utterances.transcript: And did you notice the ice? Look! We have it all! We have crushed! Cubed! And dry! Watch! Ahhh! Mystical!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (following him) And did you notice the ice? (Gestures to 3 huge buckets of ice on the table.) Look! We have it all! We have crushed! Cubed! And dry! Watch! (Pours some water onto the dry ice, causing it to evaporate/smoke.) Ahhh! Mystical!

utterances.transcript: Awesome!
Chandler! Everyone--no one's eating my Tuscan finger food 'cause they're all filling up on Phoebe's snow cones!
There are snow cones! Snow cones! Yuck!
utterances.transcript_with_note: There are snow cones! (Monica glares at him.) Snow cones! Yuck!

utterances.transcript: Y'know...go! Go! Right there!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Y'know...go! Go! Right there! (Points)

utterances.transcript: Thank you! Thank you!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thank you! Thank you! (Runs to the snow cone machine.)
(Rachel enters.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, look! Look! Look!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (noticing her) Oh, look! Look! Look!

utterances.transcript: Surprise!!
What?! What?! My birthday's not for another month!
That's the surprise!
Oh my God! You guys this is so great! I mean it's so unexpected! I mean Chandler's birthday is even before mine!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Everyone stops and looks at Chandler, who's nodding.)

utterances.transcript: Surprise!
Wow! This is great! Look at all these cups! This is so weird.
I was in charge of cups.
Oh, okay, not so weird.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Cut to another part of the room, Ross is going to talk to Joey.]

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Hey.
Listen man, uh, I'm sorry the audition didn't go so well.
Yeah right!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah right! (Gets up for a refill to his snow cone.)

utterances.transcript: No really, I-I am! I feel bad!
Yeah? Well look Ross, you don't have to. Okay? It's not your fault I suck. I mean what kind of an actor can't even say, "Hmm, noodle soup."
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah? Well look Ross, you don't have to. Okay? It's not your fault I suck. I mean what kind of an actor can't even say, "Hmm, noodle soup." (Nods his head in disgust.)

utterances.transcript: Yeah y'know what? Maybe-maybe you didn't mess up your audition because you suck, maybe you messed up because you care more about uh, your godson.
What you do mean?
I think, sub-consciously...
Wait-whoa-whoa, you lost me.
I think on some level, you-you sabotaged your own audition so that Ben would get the part.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (pause) I think on some level, you-you sabotaged your own audition so that Ben would get the part.

utterances.transcript: Well, you're way sounds a lot better than mine. Yeah. Yeah! It's not that I'm a bad actor...
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, you're way sounds a lot better than mine. (Thinks about it.) Yeah. Yeah! It's not that I'm a bad actor...

utterances.transcript: No!
No, it's just ah, I care so damn much about little Ben that uh, it was more important to see him succeed.
There you go. Thank you!
Thank you! So, did-did he get it?
No.
Eh, what are you gonna do?

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The smoker's balcony, Kim and Nancy are out smoking as Chandler sticks his head out the door.]

utterances.transcript: Oh, hi! Excuse me, is uh Rachel Green here? I was supposed to meet her for lunch.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Kim and Nancy) Oh, hi! Excuse me, is uh Rachel Green here? I was supposed to meet her for lunch.

utterances.transcript: Oh, she doesn't come down here any more. You can find her up on ten.
Okay, great.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Kim exhales and Chandler stares at it longingly.)

utterances.transcript: So we talked about the whole presentation yesterday at lunch and he wondered if one person would be enough to get a take on the trip and I said, "Yeah, absolutely!"
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Nancy) So we talked about the (Chandler sneaks closer to her cigarette) whole presentation yesterday at lunch (Closer) and he wondered if one person would be enough (Closer) to get a take on the trip (Still closer) and I said, "Yeah, absolutely!" (She's interrupted by Chandler who has reached his goal and takes a drag from her cancer stick.)

utterances.transcript: I'll catch you guys later.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'll catch you guys later. (Exits.)
End

plots: Chandler takes a drag from Kim 's cigarette .
Chandler was looking for Rachel Green on the smoker 's balcony .
But Rachel 's not very enthusiastic to fall into the bad habit , which is bad for her as Kim and Nancy bond during cigarette breaks and Nancy advises Kim on the executive decision .
Rachel fears for her position , as Kim and Nancy have more time to spend together , and tries to talk Kim and Nancy into quitting , but fails when she catches them smoking behind her back .
Kim warns Rachel that she 'll fire her if she catches her with a cigarette , and Rachel has no choice but to do so - just as Kim invites Nancy on a trip to Paris with her .
Kim and Nancy talk about the presentation while having a smoke on the balcony .
